verses.verse: A Psalm of David <WH1732>. Blessed <WH1288> <WH8803> be the YY <WH3068> my strength <WH6697>, which teacheth <WH3925> <WH8764> my hands <WH3027> to war <WH7128>, and my fingers <WH676> to fight <WH4421>:

My goodness <WH2617>, and my fortress <WH4686>; my high tower <WH4869>, and my deliverer <WH6403> <WH8764>; my shield <WH4043>, and he in whom I trust <WH2620> <WH8804>; who subdueth <WH7286> <WH8802> my people <WH5971> under me.
YY <WH3068>, what is man <WH120>, that thou takest knowledge <WH3045> <WH8799> of him! or the son <WH1121> of man <WH582>, that thou makest account <WH2803> <WH8762> of him!
Man <WH120> is like <WH1819> <WH8804> to vanity <WH1892>: his days <WH3117> are as a shadow <WH6738> that passeht away <WH5674> <WH8802>.
Bow <WH5186> <WH8685> thy heavens <WH8064>, O YY <WH3068>, and come down <WH3381> <WH8799>: touch <WH5060> <WH8798> the mountains <WH2022>, and they shall smoke <WH6225> <WH8799>.
Cast forth <WH1299> <WH8798> lightning <WH1300>, and scatter <WH6327> <WH8686> them: shoot out <WH7971> <WH8798> thine arrows <WH2671>, and destroy <WH2000> <WH8799> them.

Send <WH7971> <WH8798> thine hand <WH3027> from above <WH4791>; rid <WH6475> <WH8798> me, and deliver <WH5337> <WH8685> me out of great <WH7227> waters <WH4325>, from the hand <WH3027> of strange <WH5236> children <WH1121>;
Whose mouth <WH6310> speaketh <WH1696> <WH8765> vanity <WH7723>, and their right hand <WH3225> is a right hand <WH3225> of falsehood <WH8267>.

I will sing <WH7891> <WH8799> a new <WH2319> song <WH7892> unto thee, O 'Elohim <WH430>: upon a psaltery <WH5035> and an instrument of ten strings <WH6218> will I sing praises <WH2167> <WH8762> unto thee.
It is he that giveth <WH5414> <WH8802> salvation <WH8668> unto kings <WH4428>: who delivereth <WH6475> <WH8802> David <WH1732> his servant <WH5650> from the hurtful <WH7451> sword <WH2719>.

Rid <WH6475> <WH8798> me, and deliver <WH5337> <WH8685> me from the hand <WH3027> of strange <WH5236> children <WH1121>, whose mouth <WH6310> speaketh <WH1696> <WH8765> vanity <WH7723>, and their right hand <WH3225> is a right hand <WH3225> of falsehood <WH8267>:

That our sons <WH1121> may be as plants <WH5195> grown up <WH1431> <WH8794> in their youth <WH5271>; that our daughters <WH1323> may be as corner stones <WH2106>, polished <WH2404> <WH8794> after the similitude <WH8403> of a palace <WH1964>:

That our garners <WH4200> may be full <WH4392>, affording <WH6329> <WH8688> all manner of store <WH2177> <WH2177>: that our sheep <WH6629> may bring forth thousands <WH503> <WH8688> and ten thousands <WH7231> <WH8794> in our streets <WH2351>:
That our oxen <WH441> may be strong to labour <WH5445> <WH8794>; that there be no breaking in <WH6556>, nor going out <WH3318> <WH8802>; that there be no complaining <WH6682> in our streets <WH7339>.
Happy <WH835> is that people <WH5971>, that is in such a case <WH3602>: yea, happy <WH835> is that people <WH5971>, whose 'Elohim <WH430> is the YY <WH3068>.
